page.title: 13AGRICULTURE IN THE AREA
page.content: GENERAL DESCRIPTION Almost the whole of the block is agri- cultural land but the use to which it is put varies with the height. The low fields near the River Severn are marshy and are regularly flooded. They are unsuitable for crops and are used as cattle or sheep pasture. The higher ground is used for cereals, orchards or beans. There is woodland on the steeper parts of Woolridge. We interviewed many farmers and were surprised by the differences between the farms. They all looked alike to us! Most farms are run with very few lab- ourers, machines have replaced people. One or two have changed from dairy to beef cattle as less work is involved. Some farms have combined to form more efficient units. One landowner has now stopped farming and just rents fields to other farmers.
